content.text:
# Draft:Michael Reed (historian)

Michael Reed (aged 59 in 2024) is an Australian historian known for his extensive research into the British royal family, with a particular focus on the Middleton family.  He  studied  in Victoria at Warrnambool's  Christian Brothers' College and Monash University in Melbourne. His work explores the dynamics between the royals, Meghan Markle the Middleton family, offering insights into the latter's rise to prominence. Reed has contributed and written for prominent UK publications such as The Guardian, The Daily Telegraph, Sunday Telegraph, Daily Express, Daily Mail, and Mail on Sunday. He has collaborated with author Robert Lacey and journalist Claudia Joseph to further expanded his research, providing in-depth analysis of royal affairs. Reed's appearances on BBC Radio, his books and research articles offer a unique perspective on royal history and contemporary British monarchy.
